body:
hello, thanks for bring this up!

is this also an issue in the new `eslint.config.js`: https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/configuration-files-new? if yes, we can fix it, but `eslintrc` is frozen - we won't make any changes. :)

I support this, assuming that the proposal is that we change the default ignore pattern. As @aladdin-add noted, we can consider this change only for the new config system, which has the same behavior in this regard:

https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/5ea15d92ee358e8f3f652c94c019cac96aaec651/lib/config/default-config.js#L48-L54

For context, the default ignore pattern was `/node_modules/` before we changed it to `/node_modules/*` in eslint v2.5.0 (https://github.com/eslint/eslint/commit/1beacc8cc2fba2826abe317e8a16589647c009f9). I believe the intent was to make it easier to unignore individual subdirectories under `node_modules` when needed.

For example, if you want to unignore `node_modules/foo/`, with the current default ignore pattern you'll need only one line:

```
!node_modules/foo/
```

If we remove the trailing `*` from the default ignore pattern, you'd need two more lines, one to unignore the directory and another to re-ignore subdirectories:

```
!node_modules/
node_modules/*
!node_modules/foo/
```

In my opinion, unignoring anything in `node_modules` is a rare use case, and avoiding the few extra lines required to configure this doesn't justify slowing down execution for everyone else.

> For context, the default ignore pattern was /node_modules/ before we changed it to /node_modules/* in eslint v2.5.0 (https://github.com/eslint/eslint/commit/1beacc8cc2fba2826abe317e8a16589647c009f9). I believe the intent was to make it easier to unignore individual subdirectories under node_modules when needed.

Yes, that's correct.

Given that we will be completely eliminating this code path very soon, and because this would be a breaking change, I'd suggest we leave this as-is and instead focus on ensuring that the flat config code path doesn't suffer from the same performance issues.

I support changing the default pattern to `**/node_modules/` in the new config system. That way, the search will not go into `node_modules` directories unless the user unignores them.

@nzakas what do you think?

I'm fine with that so long as it's still possible to unignore files in `node_modules` somehow. I'd also suggest we should explicitly add instructions for doing this into the documentation for flat config.

This change is now accepted for the new config system.

@Krinkle would you like to submit a pull request to implement this change?
I'm afraid I won't be able to find the time between the other open source projects I maintain. Perhaps a few months from now, but I'd rather not "cookielick" this.

issue.title: feat: change default ignore pattern to `**/node_modules/` in flat config
